instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the estimation accuracy of soil heavy metals, and how well did this metric perform in the related study on soil heavy metal estimation?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the estimation accuracy of soil heavy metals in the study was the coefficient of determination (R-P(2)). The R-P(2) values were used to assess the performance of the models for estimating different heavy metals. 

For estimating Cr, the FOD with an order of 0.75 yielded an R-P(2) value of 0.74, indicating a relatively good estimation accuracy. 

For estimating Zn, the FOD with an order of 0.75 yielded an R-P(2) value of 0.81, indicating a higher estimation accuracy compared to Cr. 

For estimating Pb, the FOD with an order of 0.5 resulted in an R-P(2) value of 0.56, indicating a lower estimation accuracy compared to Cr and Zn. 

Overall, the chosen metric performed reasonably well in evaluating the estimation accuracy of soil heavy metals, with higher R-P(2) values indicating better performance.
